Game doesn't work with newer computers, so be wary if you're buying it and have a newer computer as odds are it wont' start upon clicking the start button..

This has been a known issue for a while and the devs have yet to address it and quite frankly likely never will address it.. My review will change if they ever decide to fix the issue..

While a few work arounds exist, anything that requires me to go tinker with my computer settings to get the game running outside of using compatibility mode or running as administrator is something which shouldn't be sold on steam, or should have a warning on the store page..  Better yet it should be fixed since it's been reported on the forums for months at this point..

Also the game was released in 2020, so not running on newer computers is lazy developing..   It's even lazier when you see that the issue has been fixed by gamers rather then the developers who won't take the time to fix the problem..

A fun simulator to pick up and play with some interesting mechanics
This is a remendous game that I would higly reccomend to other people looking for multiple weeks of fun.

It's a smaller indie game so expect a few stock assets, dated graphics and a few minor bugs (ie the sky doesn't cloud over when it rains, NPCs occasionally get stuck on each other, little stuff like that) but I haven't encountered anything totally game breaking since the endgame update. 

One thing to be aware of is that this IS NOT a GTA game, there is NO COMBAT OR OBTAINABLE WEAPONS whatsoever and no rival gangs (your gang affiliation is chosen automatically at a certain XP level based on your play style thus far and you do not interact with gangs you aren't affiliated with at all), your only enemies are the police patrols and the DEA. Police will fire their tazers at you if you run, that's the closest thing to gun play this game has...

As for the game play itself, it's highly addictive, more addictive than most of the substances you'll be selling ;)
Something about the way the NPCs are programmed and the layout of the map combined with the open nature of the stealth mechanics creates such a level of tension that it just captures the soul crushing anxiety of running around in places you really shouldn't be with things you really shouldn't have perfectly.

Really looking forward to co-op when DDS2 gets released!

Putting aside the criminal theme and aesthetic, Drug Dealer Simulator is a surprisingly competent trading simulator that goes beyond the basics of "buy low, sell high" and includes elements of logistics, distribution management, smuggling, police avoidance and money laundering. While these elements are not particularly deep, all together they do make a rather engaging trade experience. If you are a fan of economic or trading simulators I would recommend giving the demo a try.

with the development of the second game coming to a close, i felt the need to give this game the review it deserves. the addition of content from where the game started has been amazing, keeping it fresh and fun to follow along. the $20 price tag is really good to see, while the rest of the world steadily maximize their profits, indie games are becoming beasts in the industry. 

the game is really simple at it's core and i'm hoping to see it expanded upon in the sequel. dodging basic npc cops, running across the world to sell 2gs and not having much to do between selling the same people a ton of product; the game isn't perfect, but what is here is effective and feeds my lizard brain plenty of dopamine, while enjoying my favorite streamers.

if the devs are reading, i hope you'll check out the rest of my review, meant only with love and intent to help fuel this fire!
overall you all did fucking great, from voice acting, to the music, this is one of my favorite games and i hope the sequel is everything this aspires to be from it's humble start <3

suggestions (even if the release is close, hope you'll check it out)

1. less maze like sections, in what has come to be harshly branded a running simulator
2. reducing customers completely in sections you've obtained a dealer
3. less mini sections (west dead mid dead east dead) and just have one big section, it's a bit much
4. mixes that have different names, but the same mix not being able to be integrated (fix)
5. being able to move product right from inventory to storage (sometimes it's easiest to pull out 50 1gs and when you fuck up, it's impossibly boring to fix the mistake)
6. some sort of mini games in line with a rpgsim to juggle down time, especially early on, like eating, watching tv, gambling casino something man. rather than just clicking wait and staring at the screen for five minutes
7. less check points, more in depth police. even with minimum exposure the amount of cops don't seem to correlate. i just see squads of cops everywhere and all of these checkpoints, and the area is like 2 freakin blocks, even in a gaming sim, it is just sometimes way too much
8. would love to see more control as a dealer, picking spots to meet that become hot over time and use, setting times that people know you operate during, and having down time for other rpgsim mechanics, like sleep eat and pleasure.
9. with the amount of amazing graffiti art in this game, the symbol choice is disappointing, but still a really cool mechanic. instead of having a bunch of small places to graffiti, it would be amazing to see each sector have a specific spot you go to spray, and have multiple layers to the mini game when painting it, and once it's done, it keeps your respect at like 50% or something and you have to come back to maintain the paint!
10. would love to see more engaging relationships, the characters that are there are really cool, especially the narrator, (i'm hoping you guys bring them back for more, even if we'll be playing as eddie) but would love to see some more interaction when interacting. 

i hope someone from the dev team checks this out and i hope you see it as someone who loves and really wants to see the sequel do well. congrats and good luck to the upcoming release!

Although somewhat unrealistic for a ‚Äúsimulation‚Äù game, this is a fun indie game worth the price of admission. It is set in a dystopian near future in which ‚Äúguest citizens‚Äù in the US live in confined neighborhoods (ghettos, literally) heavily controlled by the police - complete with night time curfew, checkpoints, numerous patrols and random searches of pedestrians. 

You start out as a local low-level dealer with connections to the cartel. You slowly build your drug dealer enterprise from scratch, level up your character and increase the revenue, all while avoiding the police as best you can. You use your encrypted laptop to order drugs from your cartel connection and collect orders from customers. As you progress you‚Äôll eventually get more connections who‚Äôll help you launder your illegal money, buy real estate, etc. It is quite rewarding. 

You can create various mixes and thus change the properties of your products, e.g. make them less pure and/or more addictive. The mixing allows for some creative experimentation but you can skip this entirely and still do fine or, if you‚Äôre like me, just keep it simple and mix in a small amount of powdered sugar or baking powder to increase profit. 

The game doesn‚Äôt hold your hand - you need to stay organized and plan ahead: you must keep track of the content of mixes you‚Äôve made, make sure you have everything you need before heading out to deliver the goods, etc. This is one of the main gameplay aspects that either makes or breaks the game depending on your preferences. The other main aspects are the aforementioned growth of your business, mixing of your products plus the stealth element that comes into play when you try to avoid the police patrols during curfew (at which time they will arrest you on sight). If you like that kind of stuff, this game just might be for you. 

Contrary to what one might expect from a drug dealer simulation, you don‚Äôt ever use violence or intimidation and you don‚Äôt have any real opposition in the form of rival dealers or anything like that. It‚Äôs all there just for you, really, and if you just avoid the police and stay organized you‚Äôll do fine. The story missions are a bit meh - you go from A to B, talk to people, search for stuff, pick stuff up and put stuff in receptacles. Not much else to it. The final ‚Äúendgame‚Äù update completed the story in a cool way and saw some improved animations but the missions were still all based on the same basic functions. 

As mentioned earlier, police will arrest you on sight during curfew but they‚Äôll completely ignore your customers. There are a few little flaws like this. Also, and this is my main criticism, the world and the people in it doesn‚Äôt seem quite alive, it doesn‚Äôt feel like you are in a real world in which people live real lives which you can impact. They are only there to function as customers, vendors or obstacles for the growth of your business. This makes the game feel somewhat basic and incomplete. 

Still, even with the flaws it is a fun indie game which I‚Äôve enjoyed a lot. It is unlike any game I have ever played and the final update tied it all together nicely. The game has been vastly improved since the first release a couple of years back and I look forward to what‚Äôs coming next.

Sad to leave a No. I can't recommend this game after the patch that broke coke sales. The game is really a running simulator, just running around dodging pretty simple to avoid cops. I liked the game in it's earlier state where you could sell large quantity to Ballena Gang and didn't have to rely on 2g-20g sales.
    The devs seemed to break the game on purpose, I don't think anyone really likes selling less drugs in the game as that is the name of the game. I feel like this game was an early access, however it wasn't listed as such to my knowledge. Then instead of making the game better, they changed it to where people won't even order coke, and the ballena cartel orders like 1 small shipment a month... not even half a key for cartel...get real.(even this in game is hyped up when you do the mission he acts like you hit a big deal, nope)
    I know a while back they announced a dds 2, I wouldn't bother with it either after how they did this game. Shame because this is something people like to fantasize about, it could probably compete with GTA5, but they just made it a running simulator and announced a new game and broke this one... They always came out with grand promises of new content, hyping things making it sound better than it ever was, but all that was ever delivered was a nothing burger. I would recommend you not waste your time or money.
    At some point you have to consider that breaking the game I paid for and liked, and offering me no way to go back, is worthy of refund. I may have hundred plus hours in a game when I enjoy it but then you make a game breaking patch that ruins my purchase, that's BS. 
     It's theft by deception to offer someone one thing, then give them a different product they don't like, and not offer the original purchase or a refund because they are not satisfied. That's the law in brick and mortar business and it should apply to digital sales as well.---it doesn't, they are covered for this type of scummy business practice with creative rights and such, and the only way to combat it is our collective honest reviews.
    I'm just thankful that this game wasn't expensive in the first place, I did get some enjoyment from it in the earlier stages, sad they changed that new customers won't buy your drugs even if you hand out thousands of dollars of free samples, sad you can't do any big quantity orders. 
    As with any negative review I leave, I am doing this as a warning to hopefully save someone some disappointment. If you watch videos of how the game was(if you bother researching) and see things that look good... make sure the video you are watching is recent and not old information, do your own research and make your own opinion, this is just mine.
    I am thankful for the devs who put in hard work to offer me 248 hours of gameplay at a good value price, and hope they hear this criticism as just what it is, my honest opinion on the state of the game. Hopefully something can be learned for your future game, and I wish the team the best of luck in the future.

Drug Dealer Simulator is a simulation game developed by Byterunners Game Studio and published by Movie Games S.A. It is available on PC and allows players to experience the life of a drug dealer in a fictional city.

The game allows players to run their own drug operation, starting with small-time deals and gradually building their empire. Players must navigate the world of drug dealing, buying and selling a variety of substances, and building relationships with customers and other dealers.

One of the key features of Drug Dealer Simulator is its detailed mechanics, which include managing inventory, setting prices, and avoiding law enforcement. Players must also manage their reputation, balancing their criminal activity with the need to keep a low profile and avoid drawing too much attention to themselves.

The game's world is highly detailed, with a variety of locations to explore and conduct business. Players can also customize their character, unlocking new skills and abilities as they progress through the game.

Drug Dealer Simulator also features a morality system, where players must make difficult decisions that can impact their reputation and the overall success of their operation. This adds an extra layer of complexity to the gameplay, as players must balance their desire for profit with their own personal values.

Overall, Drug Dealer Simulator offers a unique and engaging experience for players who are interested in the world of drug dealing and criminal activity. While the subject matter may not be for everyone, fans of simulation and strategy games may find plenty to enjoy here. The game's mechanics are highly detailed, and the world is richly realized, making for a highly immersive and entertaining experience.

Drug Dealer Simulator is a unique, fresh, and incredibly immersive experience that I've been hooked on since I first started playing. The game puts you in the shoes of a drug dealer as they make their way through the underworld of crime and compete against rival gangs. You must manage your resources, build a drug empire, and make money by selling your product to customers.

The gameplay is excellent, with lots of depth and plenty of options to explore. You can purchase and upgrade different types of drugs, expand your business, and even hire additional gang members to help you out. You'll need to manage your money wisely, as you'll be dealing with a variety of NPCs, customers, and rival gangs who will all be looking to get their hands on your product. It's incredibly satisfying to watch your business grow and profit, and it's also quite challenging as you'll have to carefully manage your resources and make sure you don't get in too deep.

The visuals and sound design are also top-notch. The art style is gritty and detailed, and the sound design is excellent, with realistic sound effects and ambient music that adds an extra layer of immersion to the game.

Overall, Drug Dealer Simulator is an excellent game that offers a unique style of gameplay.

I would give this a neutral review if I could, was thinking of recommending it but after hearing the Dev's responses to their player base I feel like it has to be given a thumbs down.
 
I understand that this game was made by a small indie team, is only $20, and compared to most sim games or games of this style it actually has some nice polish to it and actually has time and energy put into it. However, it has a lot of elements missing to the game that would take it from a fun time to a viral must play game that hopefully they make in DDS2 or give the game to a company with money, a bigger crew, and more time. 

Good:

-Game play is addicting and fun.
-Graphics are very acceptable.
-Some customization options in both locations and sales/location of sales.

Bad or Missing:

-Police: One of my major problems with this game is how the police work. The game needs to have a risk and reward system so it is nice that they implemented this with the police. However, they are extremely persistent which gets annoying. Being from a bad neighborhood where almost everyone is messed up on drugs I can say from observation the police don't care about shit, so for the police to search you at all hours every time they see you always gets old fast. I understand when the lights go down and it is police hours, but during the day when you are just walking around with a small bag I don't feel like you should be harassed by every single cop ever unless you were sprinting or had fucktons of drugs in a giant bag.

-Guns: What drug dealer doesn't have a gun?...I have never bought, sold, or used drugs but everything I have seen or heard is that selling drugs is dangerous. There will be junkies that will hold you up at gunpoint to get stuff for free, would be fun to blow them away if they try it. You have dealers that you give product to, what if they decide not to pay up? You hunt them down and blow them away. Cops trying to shake you down when you clearly have drugs? Blow them the fuck away and throw the bodies in the river/lake. All this could also be a system where you develop a reputation and no one will try to fuck with you, including police, because they know you aren't afraid to start lighting bitches up. So for the Dev's to tell the fan base "If you want guns go play GTA" is not only insulting to the people that gave them money but also A DRUG DEALER WOULD HAVE A GUN. Don't yell at your patrons because you are too lazy or don't have the money to implement things that would make your game better.

-Messages: On the phone don't work, would be nice to at least schedule a pickup or money drop off without having to go into a safe house.

-Jar Controls: Having to drag each individual bag to each jar is slightly tedious and not being able to put the exact amount of grams you want to take out is odd and tedious as well. Why can't I take a 4g bag of something why do I have to give my client one 1g bag and one 3g bag instead that doesn't make any sense.

-New Safe Houses: It would be nice if safe houses had a communal storage system, in the early stages of the game you run through drugs fast and can only buy so much at a time that chances are when you get a new house you won't be able to get or store drugs from there for a very long time so they are kinda useless to you aside from police escapes.

-Spending Money: I haven't gotten to this part but I hear what you can spend money on fades fast when you start making real money, you can't go on club/hooker binges, can't buy sick houses and vehicles so there is no real end game goal, and with no guns there isn't even the satisfaction of hoarding tons of cash and daring people to come at your empire. Also no drip or character customization so you can't even walk around like a boss with the swag of a God. Can't pay off the corrupt police force to not fuck with you (cause lets face it in a run down place like this place the cops would either be non-existent as mentioned before or super corrupt). 

I'm sure there are some other examples available that I either haven't gotten to yet or don't remember at the time but when it comes down to it is the game fun? Yes, it is the kind of game that you can lose hours to and be like "oh crap is it that late already?". Would I recommend the game? No, I would say wait for the second one that they are working on and watch some reviews/gameplay to see if they fixed everything. The game is good but it could have been SO much more and it is kinda sad to see them be like "we'll just make a second one and get more money that way" instead of fixing up and mastering the version they already made.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead‚Äì murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time ‚Äì something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange ‚Äì uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" ‚Äì on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, and in response, he gave me this. [Walt points to the bruise on his face left by Hank in "Blood Money."] I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. All I could think to do was to make this video and hope that the world will finally see this man for what he really is.

A game that promised much more in trailers and development than it ever delivered upon. It's littered with bugs throughout it's overall clunky system, entire mechanics that are broken to the point that it seems easier to find complex workarounds instead and gives you the overall ability to perform the same action multiple times and achieve completely different outcomes or soft lock options entirely. There are very detail lacking, copy and pasted leftover, unexplained or unfinished assets floating around for curious players to find that simply leave you questioning the random locked doors to nowhere. It lacks workshop or any support otherwise and all "updates" literally consist of content that was already in the base game. "Super Duper Graphics" just means every npc is a cabbage patch kid with a receding hairline and "End Game" was just devs blatantly ignoring outcries from everyone, while they picked and chose to ignore any and all negative feedback and contact efforts from customers to have marketing pat any half-hearted positive reviewer on the back and shell out pointless updates for their little holiday jingles they wrote in back in 8th grade. Players wanted functioning, smooth gameplay and what we got was "It's broke. Build a bunch of useless housing, straight Sims PS2 style garbage, we're busy making a new game no one asked for. $14 from everyone really adds up. Thanks."  Personally I feel the first 3rd of this game is actually done very well, it feels genuine and was lots of fun to play. I truly enjoyed it. That's the thing though, it's truly one actual third of a game and it's sad that you can feel in-game, the point when it became too much work and everyone stopped caring.

Decent game, 8-10 addictive hours of play for sure. Most of the bugs have been squashed so if you like to sneak around, deal virtual drugs, make your own mixes, rent a few properties and get rich, this is a fun distraction. 

I can now with a good conscious give a half thumbs up. There were some inaccurate advertising problems in the beginning. What was advertised and what you got were too far apart. Steam should crack down on this (pun intended). You simply should not be able to advertise all the things you are going to do and not deliver a large portion of them without some kind of notation in the actual video letting the buyer know. Take that stuff down until you put it in the game or in the video let your customer know it is coming. Period. This was very misleading. 

Second, was hoping to go full on Heisenberg with a multi-city, large operation, large equipment, high tech lab, network and all that. We are still at emerging Walter White & Jessie mode... I will update as the game develops. This would be an excellent mini-game for GTA5.

Have to say it's been over a year and no content to speak of. They post updates that mean and do nothing. They have been talking about more territory for a very long time but its not there... Lots of chatter, no production.

2023 - Much better after update. Lots of stuff added, lots of promise. Will update as I see it progress.

This game is stupid fun. 

What can I say about it? The title of the game delivers. It's a lot of running around, making deals, avoiding police, and inventory management

The Polish really know how to make fun games.

2023 EDIT: Since I made the review, many things have been added to the game. The new additions include better gameplay, an end game, more missions, and money laundering. So, money laundering.. it IS important, but do not consider that as a cool factor when it comes to buying the game because it is literally a necessary money sink and not a gameplay feature. 

Now that I have significant time playing the game, I have to say I understand it much better. There is a lot of room to improve in the sequel, but for what this is I find the price of the game to be more than fair. So, outside of buying, transporting, and selling drugs, I have to say the time spent in the drug lab is a bit better than I initially took it for. By that, I mean I dared to pull out a calculator to get the right drug mix. I try to keep my drugs 80% - 85% pure, and then use sugar and addictive drugs to weigh it down. The sugar is there because it isn't toxic and is just simply weight. Anyway, I would mix my drugs with stuff to weigh it down, then add addictive stuff like viagra to make my clients turn to addicts. Once I started to really focus on the aspect of making addicts, filling my drugs with filler, and making the right mixes then I felt like I was truly "playing the game". 

The downsides I would say is that the game can be relatively short if you know what you're doing, and by short I mean maybe 6 hours, but that is if you are playing this for the story and I hope to god you are not because thats not what we are doing here, ok? What you have as an endgame is a time dump where you are trying to earn and launder a lot of money just for some houses and pimped out drug labs. The problem with the end game is that I am spending half my time running drugs and the other half filling water bottles and watering plants. More variety would be nice, but I'm 100 hours into this playthrough so... thats on me. I keep going because I want to earn more money but there seems to be a "cap" on how fast money comes in via sales. Sales are the only way you can make money, and after 4 or 5 days I have earned about $40k, which then gets laundered into less money, to save up for $100,000k home improvements. None of this is necessary in the game, and it is at the end when you have nothing better to do so it probably doesn't matter.

Either way, love this game, it is fantastic, and I will be getting the next one

It's honestly a really fun game with a pretty solid amount of content. 

Especially for the price point (and at time of this review it was on sale for just over $11) you're definitely getting hours of fun, if you're at all interested in simulating the subject matter.  

The game doesn't treat you like an idiot, and does some interesting things.  You can't ask for much more for $20, especially since they are still adding on to the game.

I'm happy with my purchase, even the short time I've played so far I've seen all kinds of longer-term content available to me.

I had gone away from the game for a time, and wound up trying to reinstall on my new computer.  It is currently the one game I have on Steam that will not even start.  I've got a high-end computer that runs literally everything else at Ultra. 

This is ridiculous that a formerly working game that I liked is now worthless to me.

I'll edit this review if the dev fixes this bullshit.

EDIT TO REVIEW:

I'm keeping the "Not Recommended" review up, as I finally had to go and dig up a solution myself.  Four months this review was up, and the Dev didn't say a damned thing.

If your game won't start, use this link:

https://support.gog.com/hc/en-us/articles/360019775837?product=gog

Pretty bad that I had to go on GOG to get a fix.  Here's hoping the updates to this game are worth it, as it was fun before, but I'm still pissed off.

I was in a merciful mood this time and even offered the devs that I wouldn't write a negative review if they complied with my demands. Not only was I tortured with silence but the community is literally too braindead to grasp my complaints. So here we go again, the achievements in this game are not only mindless but also atrociously grindy. For instance, selling 1 ton of drugs. The maximum amount that you can sell to a dealer is 300g which isn't a lot considering you have to sell 1.000.000g for this brainless achievement. Then we have another brilliant one which demands you to kill 909 of your customers. And let's not forget the one that is literally impossible to acquire. You basically have to find an object in a trash can that never spawns. I must have searched 300 containers at this point with no luck. The public achievement progression states that 0% of players have these achievements which isn't a surprise. Who in their right mind would actually get these? I'm beyond baffled that people who haven't gotten any of these try to lecture me on how it isn't bad and that I should stop complaining.

This is a garbage 15‚Ç¨ game that I luckily got for 5‚Ç¨, yet I feel scammed. It's just like any other one of these dogshit simulator games. They even use the same fucking idle animations as Thief Simulator, are you kidding me? How lackluster can you be? How little effort can you put into your product? And speaking of product, let's talk about how awful this game. It's the same repetitive shit over and over again. You purchase/produce drugs, put them into smaller bags, sell them to people, and repeat this shit over again. The entire drug management system is an absolute disaster. For every fucking order you have to pack very specific amounts. They could have implemented a system that would restrict orders to specific amounts but that would probably take more than 2 braincells. You are constantly forced to pack additional bags of 1g, 2g, 3g just to get the number right. Asswipes, how about increments of 5g? How about making it less frustrating? No, that would actually require a minimum amount of brainpower. The entire system is annoying as a whole. Instead of making the process of bagging and mixing products as simple as possible they went ahead and created the most convoluted horseshit system I've ever seen. It really shows how little brain the developers had when making this. The AI is especially awful with some of the most random pathing I've ever seen. Stand on higher terrain and they run away from you for whatever reason. And don't get me started on the animations. They couldn't give the cops an actual animation when they search or tase you. Would be too much effort, right?

I'm done negotiating with devs that don't care about the quality of their own product. Maybe if you remove those achievements, refund my money, and post a public apology for your crimes I may consider taking this review down. As of now I'm fucking done. Why even bother at all? Why should I waste any more of my precious time explaining common sense to people who clearly have none? In any case, good riddance to this entire community. Maybe one day you will grasp what I was trying to accomplish here. Continue putting up with a garbage game that is broken to the core. I would like to elaborate on that but the entire game is one huge bug. I just love getting controlled by the cops twice in a row, really highlights the quality of your coding.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

Have played and supported this game before you could even go in the sewer, was a great game going places and doing things. Then for some reason they chose to change the Gamma setting and now its impossible to see anything at night. It actually hurts my eyes to play the game. The setting in the game do not allow you to set or change your Gamma so you have to change it manually with the Unreal console or from the Appsetting in your files. They made this change because "People weren't using the flashlight" but ask yourself, have you ever bought drugs from someone holding a flashlight? Of course you haven't, Cops carry flashlights. 

Great game and content, terrible playing experience.

to fix the Gamma issue go search for "Appsetting" find the folder "Appdata\local\drugdealersimulator\saved\config\windowsnoeditor then click on Engine.ini and at the bottom on a new line add [/script/engine.engine]DisplayGamma=3.2  (or 3.5) and you can make out the difference between a tree and a trashcan at night.

It's a good game. It's addicting (ironically) and it just keeps you going. Its core concept is super fun, and I think there should be more games like this. However, the game is still unfinished, even after it's final update. Still quite a few bugs, lack of polish and detail in important areas, and huge missed opportunities. I think the best thing the developers can do at this point, is implement steam workshop. This would introduce some of the potential the game missed, as well as adding many more fun gimmicks and things to spice the game up with. I feel adding workshop would bring a lot of players, new and old to the game. 

The best thing you as a player can do, is check out Drug Dealer Simulator 2. I think it looks more promising at the moment, and I have hope they will add a lot more content and improvements.

Uptown Kings new drug system completely ruined the fun for me. Played this game since launch and will fully admit it starting to get better and better over time. Especially the weed growing aspect was pretty dope and a nice added feature, as well as more quests if that's what you want to call them and a somewhat endgame if you will. Before the drug update you could basically turn off the drugs you didn't want to sell later on and only sell drugs that were making you profits and worth all the time you spend running around, and believe me this is almost a running simulator. Granted having the little drugs like weed and amp early game is def needed and lets you learn the in's and outs of the game as well as mixing. But beyond level 30 I would like to start feeling like i am coming up in the drug game. So like I said, before this update I could just turn on coke and H and sell that everywhere, and to everyone only. As I should be allowed, I am the drug dealer of course and you buy what I have to offer. Now what they did is tie the drugs to certain areas, Weed + amp and all the lower drugs tied to sector A. Meth + amp and sometimes a small amount of H to sector B, The big money drugs to sector C. I fully understand what they were going for, but being level 75+ I don't want to have to run weed or amp anymore, Especially after beating the game and they basically say the wold is now yours. Some of you might think well just run the coke and H still. Well again its only in Sector C and only so many people will order and its not huge amounts either. Been playing for like a week straight now and cant get a dealer out there to save my life. Literally none, and they are all addicts. Do not get me wrong, the game by all means is fun as hell to pretend to mix up all kinds of concoctions and watch the addicts flow in and your cash just pile up. With that being said as well they clearly reworked the gangs and they don't order as much and as often, that kinda blows as it was a great cash flow and made you feel like you made it big time. With a lot of the updates they did there was a handful of good things, Not going to spoil to much but the labs thing is pretty dam dope feature but still leaves a lot to be desired. Really hope they continue to improve on the game because they definitely have a one of a kind product here and could corner the market.

Great game with a lot of potential. Hope the developers listen to their community because many of these ideas would polish this gem to an absolute beauty. Very fun game- think courier simulator, but with drugs. 8/10

I'm hooked!  Really hoping for a lot of things to come in the next game.  Multiplayer would be amazing in this game.  Graphics and Engine are an older look and feel.  The GUI for mixing drugs is a little awkward at first but once you get the hang of it, they make sense.  There's a lot to be improved in this game, however taking it for what it is, the game play is ADDICTIVE.  Even though it can get repetitive I still can't put down the baggies or this game.  ;)  
Feel like I didn't make it to far after the first 30 hours.  Then lost my save game after wiping my pc but gladly started over.  Get so busy with little deals I forget to keep working towards advancements, yet somehow the game keeps you advancing.
There clearly was a lot of hard work put into making this game.  I imagine there just was not a very big team of people doing it though.  Haven't had any real bugs or glitches yet.  Really hoping the new game will be as smooth playing with even better graphics and physics but does not stray to far from what works in this original.

This isn't a terrible game, but it's clearly still early access. At least, they do seem to be updating somewhat regularly but so far there doesn't seem to be too much content being added and it REALLY DOES LACK CONTENT, especially for a supposed full game. I get they are new and this is their first game, i'm just unsure how many of their mistakes are genuine or attempts to raise funds through false advertising and misleading communication to their players.

I really hope i can recommend this game one day as it does have some really fun mechanics and good potential, it's just too hard to see what the devs intentions are right now.

EDIT: Don't buy the new game (or only buy it when its heavily discounted). They mislead on the original games trailers and watching the new squeals one it is very clear theyre doing the same thing (obviously a animated movie, no actual gameplay shown so dont belive anything you see in the new trailer). The devs refuse to listen to user input and arbitrarily decide on complete game re-huals that ruin the point of the game. IMO its very possible they will abandon the squeal early on (The original is already dead, I've got the most basic achievements and apparently only 5% of players have completed them lol). All it seems they're doing with the sequal is just trying to dupe anyone else who hasn't already brought this one (The devs had so much potential for this game, it could have been so good but they decided to ignore user feedback and ruin any potential that was left for this game).

[h1][b]TL;DR:[/b] Constantly crashes my computer as soon as I get past the main menu, display constantly flickers and this makes it impossible to click anything. Stops as soon as I close the game, but can't save for the first few hours of gameplay. Refunding. [/h1]

My feelings are mixed. I played the demo a year or two ago, it didn't run well but it was playable. 

Now it runs like a crypto miner is hidden in it, but I think that's just because changing the resolution settings in game doesn't actually change them. Changed the resolution from 720p to my native 1080p in the INI configuration files, still not working. Writing this while playing the tutorial for the 4th time, because you can't save until you've gotten through the tutorial and the past 3 times, the game kept crashing my display/GPU and I could still somewhat play but it's definitely not the experience I paid for with my other monitor constantly flickering and making it impossible to click anything. So I wouldn't buy it unless you want to be forced to replay the tutorial a billion times because you have to restart the game to apply any changed graphics settings, and I'm pretty sure changing some of them doesn't even do anything. Game is borderline unplayable, just updated my drivers, restarted my computer, scanned for malware. So it's not my computer. I have a GTX 1070ti and an AMD-3700X, so while they're not the best, they're well within the system requirements, The issue only occurs when I have the game open. As soon as it's closed, I stop having the issue. And this is apparently very common, upon searching online to attempt to troubleshoot. I really liked this game when I was able to play it, but it doesn't even work.

Can't recommend. interesting idea, gameplay is ok for the most part. But I can not, and will not ever recommend anything that has game-breaking bugs in it that the devs have acknowledged for years and refused to fix, just to move on to make a second version. You can still just magically lose all your possessions in a purchased building (no not a raid, just literally gone where you have to pickpocket back in and everything will be missing). Devs are aware of and have acknowledged the issue. Said they were fixing it in 2020... still happening as of almost 2023. Cartels are still broken. Just a shame. Good premise ruined by known issues that don't get addressed.

Get the demo, it gives you the whole game for free. Barely any content.

Well 2 months later, thought I'd update my review, since it's all but fair:

They added plants, or basically a plant. There's different species of seeds u can buy, yet they are all exactly the same, since you will end up with weed. No special name matching the brand of seeds you bought or anything. 

The whole plant stuff adds about 0.5 hours of extra gametime ( and this is added at the point you don't even sell weed anymore because you will have unlocked far more expensive stuff netting you a lot more money )

Final verdict:

Since the people playing this game are very excited for "weather" being added and a "remaster" of a few months old game.. this game is pretty much dead.

Get the demo and you can experience EVERYTHING the game has to offer, expect the plant growing.

Sad, loved the initial idea, poorest execution ever.

EDIT: Endgame update;

Yeah, still less content then an early acces game, very unfinished, multiple players experiencing bugs where they can't even start the game.
Besides the fact that before dropping the "end game" update ( which is basically just dumbed down houseflipper added to the asset flips ) they announced that they couldn't succeed in what they initially planned for this game and are just abandoning it, while ofcourse at the same time announcing DDS2 asking you to please spend your money again.

In short, dont..

I got this game over a year ago, enjoyed it thoroughly and then upgraded my computer. Apparently this game doesn't run on 11th gen processors and its been a known issue by the devs for over a year. Every time I or anyone else ask about it in their discussion page they send you a youtube video of some weird fat dude using a 360p camera telling you how to edit your bios settings and shit to make the game work. Fuck you Im not using some sketchy fix by some weirdo unassociated with the development of this game, its the developers job to fix their game and make it playable on newer processors OR to make it clear on the store page that it WILL NOT RUN on 11TH GEN PROCESSORS. Disclaim or fix and ill change my review back to positive because I truly enjoyed this game while I was able to play.

TL;DR Game does not run on newer computers, if you got an older computer its fun i'd recommend but dont expect any bug fixes from these devs you get what you get.

this is a great game, and my local dispo didn't pay me anything to say that.

 seriously tho, it's fun, addicting, and yes, repetitive. but the repetition varies. you might be moving product one day, buying some another, selling them another. the people who complain about repetition are the same people who say "selling 7 bags of 2-3g of flower is unrealistic". so is the idea you're going to buy product, make product, and sell all that product and make your full money's value all in a single day. you're not the columbian cartel. you're a dealer in the ghetto. the half of you complaining about realism have literally never dealt a gram in your life, so shove it. 

the other half of you are the ones complaining about the dev cycle. is this a perfect game? no. far from it. it could be so much more, but at the time could be so much less. this is a *good* game. not a great, award-winning, GOTY game, but it's a good game. and to be fair, i can see how the repetition is boring and unplayable. but that doesn't make this a good game. same way the grind of gta online doesn't make that a bad game. it's just not the playstyle you're looking for. don't be mad at the devs for not having the same artistic ideas as you. you can LITERALLY download and use the game engine they built this game with, so if you have such a problem that you have to leave a bad review over something not tailored to you, then do something about it. 

final note, it's a good game. i love it, i have just under 100 hrs in it. it could be wayyyy better, and that's what DDS2 is suppsoed to represent. ways to improve. anyone who follows the dev team and their posts would know this.

soo... you wanna be the king of drug trade and weed production???  let's try drug dealer simulator! its damn addicting and massively repeating but you'll won't regret it to buy this game. you will be a nameless guy(you can name your hero later to be the kingpin you like to be) wich works his own way to the top in a refugee camp/ghetto somewhere in america i think... you'll start with smaller weed deals for a regional carteldealer and make your way up to the top with producing and selling your own drugs, hirering dealers and renting hideouts and making them produce drugs. you will spend your gametime mostly with packing drugs for sell and bring them to the costumer.. day by day and with extra EP pionts in the night again every time on the run followed bei the feds. in my opinion is dds a really solid game with some simple selling and producing mechanics that isn't really adventures but the whole "thing" by its self is soo damn thrilling and shocking that i can't stop playing it! i really love the thrill when i'm stalking through the night in the hunt for costumers and hunted by cops! massively repeating and ADDICTING!!!
so give it a try and become your own cartel boss.

I wish i could give this a positive review, but sadly if you have a gen 11 or gen12 CPU you cannot play this without lagging hardcore.

Will update this post if devs decide to fix this issue. games unplayable with the severe performance loss.

UPDATE:
From the help of information provided on the descussion form with similar problems i had i was able to get the game running. If your having stuttering issues / unable to start issues follow this:

1. For no start issue: look on youtube for drug dealer not starting and follow the steps for getting it started
2. If you boot it and its doing excessive amounts of lagging/stuttering change your resolution to 1920x1080 for some reason the game HATES anything above that resolution.

I will still be leaving my review negative until DDS provides a problem free experience and i'm not required to have a masters in computer science to run the game.

Good game to pretend to be Walter White for $6, you can easily get a dozen hours of gameplay out of it. The gameplay loop is addicting but after a while the game gets a little stale. Police become nothing more than a slight inconvenience that you can easily outrun, if you even get caught. Checkpoints are completely redundant since you can just throw your bag over the wall. Dealers have little use besides just buying more volume off you, they don't serve your clients for you so you'll often find yourself ignoring customers who want 2g of fet halfway across the map in favor of dealers who want 50g of fet and come right outside your apartment. Crypto is useless and I'm pretty sure bugged too because I've never gotten money after selling crypto. Like one reviewer said, clients buy in super goofy gram amounts that no one in real life would buy(17g, 41g, 33g, 58g, etc.) and after a while it does become a bit of a hassle. And also for some reason the model for LSD and Mushrooms is the same as the powdered drugs lol.

I recommend it for $6, which is what I paid, but probably not for any more than that. The game is a large pond that's just a bit shallow. Hope they add lean in the next one

This game is a lot of fun. I have played it for nearly 170 hours at the time of writing this review. The development of this game was a mess, and the game was released two years early. It started off in an incomplete state. It should have been labeled early access until the 2022 Endgame Update. Now that the game is finished in 2022, I have better things to say about it. The Endgame update added a lot of good late game content.

This game is essentially a wide open sandbox crime game. It does not have violence/fighting in it, other than trying to escape police. It can get a bit repetitive, but I like that I can spend hours playing it. I ended up buying this game for friends/family members once it was completed in 2022.

first off I want to say to anyone that thinks about buying this game- do it, it's really fucking worth it imo. so as of writing this I have 282 hours in DDS, most of them of course before the endgame update, and I've been really enjoying it for quite a long time. the atmosphere in the ghetto is pretty good, kind of dark and gloomy and gives you that lowlife ghetto feel, and the variety of ways you can actually succeed or fail in your job as a drug dealer is astounding, you can do so many mixes with so many additives and combine the drugs and make some crazy shit to get people addicted like crazy but you got to be careful with the ratio and even scientific almost that I feel like Walter White when I cut and remix my meth for the clients. if to summarize overall the game I think offers a good amount of content for it's price and can be very very fun, and it feels good to have supported this game early on because it turns out to be a good early access title which is quite rare these days, the devs did a good job throughout the whole process, kept good communication with the players and overall seem to have the right mindset of devs that just want to make a good cool game so I'd suggest if you like DDS from what you've seen support them because we rarely see honest devs like this

This game is broken as fuck... 

1. You can add the required amount of drugs to a dealer but they'll reject it for no reason frequently: https://ibb.co/9VTxfzm
2. You get trapped in conversations with NPCs because you have to click their prompts instead of just spamming ESC to run away.
3. You can't adjust the game's gamma in the menus; you have to add code into the config files themselves. The default gamma is far too dark to see almost anything at times.
4. You can't fire dealers/clients. There's a limited amount of each you can have and if they're in a low-tier zone you'll just be stuck with them and you can't progress.
5. Even when you start selling larger quantities; clients will still add on stupid amounts which make it a pain in the ass to plan a drug run.... fuck you '302 grams' order... fucking round it to something reasonable. Because of this; at later stages in the game you'll still just be nickel and dime-ing your way through. 
6. You can only join 1 of the 2 gangs and even when you do they'll almost never send you orders. The whole gang thing is pointless.

It's a cool concept for a game but ends up just being a broken cookie-clicker formula. The story/missions can be completed in <2hr and the rest is just a grind. 

Apparently the devs have said they won't allow for modding so there's nothing more for this game moving forward. This game feels unfinished and yet they've already announced DDS 2.

Don't waste your money.

Drug Dealer Simulator is actually a pretty fun game. The gameplay loop is addicting, building your drug empire is fun and satisfying, and the monologues from the protagonist are pretty funny. I see a lot of potential in this game

Key word "potential"

Apparently, this game has had a lot of bugs even since launch that went unfixed. I had a dealer that became forever stuck since I could not collect my money from her. I went on the forums to ask how to deal with this, and I got a response that went "wait, the devs didn't patch this glitch?"

Onto the topic of the missing content: I'm gonna go on a limb and give them the benefit of a doubt that these features just didn't get in the final game for one reason or another. Budget, technical issues, game development is a tricky process, especially for a indie game of this scope. Though, I wish they could be more transparent about it, which I think is the cause for the community being upset over this.

Something I am worried about is how they announced a sequel before the Endgame update came, which is extremely questionable. I hope the developers learned their lesson and make the second game at least better.

While I think this is a good game, I can't in good faith recommend due to some issues concerning the game itself and the developers.

The gameplay loop is pretty great. You order the stuff, then cut it if you wish, then receive buy orders and deliver. That's the positives done, but it's a strong enough positive for me to recommend buying the game on sale.

Onto the negatives:

The UI is garbage. The laptop stuff is ok, but the equipment and management of your products is completely fiddly and unintuitive. Quality of life be damned. For instance you'll get an order for 19g of something, well you can't just make a packet of 19g. You get a choice of 1, 2, 3, 5, 10, 20, 50g so you have to add up packets to reach 19g. Now imagine you have 10 orders, which aren't displayed in any particular order, of 3 different products, all of which are random amounts. You have to work out what adds up to what, all in your head or on paper.

Navigating the map is a pain, some walls you can jump over, some you can't because reasons. The real hassle though is cross sector, which leads on to....

The sector system is the biggest issue I have with the game. You start in sector A, and eventually unlock sectors B and C. However it is not worth your time to bother with anything outside sector A because travelling to those areas is a major pain and you'll make just as much money in the starting sector. As such, I am now level 77, have maxed out all skills with more money than I can spend, and I've no interest in expanding into the mid or top tier sectors.

It's not drastically buggy, but there are some annoyances. I've had instances where dead-drops don't appear, clients that aren't interact-able, and the mission system itself doesn't seem to work. One of the beginner quests is to reach 500 rep with a local gang and in nearly 40 hours play I've only had one mission from them that got me 80 rep.

I have been waiting for some development to write this review, but since the devs just released the 'Endgame Update', I am ready to tell you: this is a scam.

I keep playing because I like the gameplay loop, but I would not purchase it again. They do not deserve that money.

It looks half finished. The game has three sectors, of which the second is half empty and the third one is a wasteland with a few buildings and props here and there. ALL the buildings except for your apartment and the mafia boss mansion are literally four walls and that's it. Everything feels empty, hollow, unfinished.

There are a few bugs which are not game-breaking, but they add to that feeling of being playing some kind of prototype, a beta or something, not a supposedly finished game.

Do not buy this game. The devs added a three quests and a new type of building and stated that was all, that is the whole 'Endgame' we are given. And they have already started developing Drug Dealer Simulator 2, so you get an idea of what to expect.

[h1]Bug-ridden mess with obscure interface[/h1]
[list]
[*]Has incredibly floaty mouse controls. Immediately went to forums. No clear fix and many people just saying "deal with it lol, you get used to it"
[*]Tried recommendations of adjusting mouse DPI and lowering in-game sensitivity to 0. Nope.
[*]Worked out I could lower the resolution to fix it, but this made the in-game mouse cursor and OS cursor appear at different spots on the screen, making it really annoying to use the UI.
[*]While alt-tabbing to find fixes, game gets locked into windowed mode. Great.
[*]Decided to continue anyway. The game wasn't about to let me save yet anyhow, so I'm locked in to playing in a window until it does, I guess! Cool, guys!
[*]Got to the point where I needed to sell to someone. Couldn't break up what I had on me, and wasn't told by the game how to do this. Again to forums. Oh, workbench.
[*]The workbench. God. An incredibly unintuitive system with awful controls (only mousewheel to change menu selection, for instance). Couldn't figure out how to take anything off the workbench after 10 minutes, couldn't recombine packages ... and this time, [i]no[/i] help on forums. I can generally figure out obscure controls, being a programmer and an occasional Dwarf Fortress player, but this was just too janky to bother putting in the time to deal with. I assume if I continued I'd encounter equally terrible design decisions. Time to RQ and get a refund.
[/list]

tl;dr: It's a really amateurish game with a lot of bugs, and I'm pretty sure the only reason people recommend it is because it lets them live out their Walter White fantasy. Protip: just do it IRL instead. That would be more entertaining and less stressful than this dumpster fire of a game.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead‚Äì murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time ‚Äì something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange ‚Äì uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" ‚Äì on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, and in response, he gave me this. [Points to bruise on face.] I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. All I could think to do was to make this video and hope that the world will finally see this man for what he really is.

In the past few years we have been swamped with many 'simulator' games. These games have, for the most part, been janky, cheaply made cash-grabs that feel unfinished, and often times are. 

This is *NOT* one of those games.

This game is good. Really good. Not only does it feel like a completed product, but it goes above and beyond what I expected. I expected a few hours of handing out drugs before it got boring. But the game delivers so much more. This is easily the best game with 'simulator' in the title that I've played, and possibly the best simulator game I've played.

Others have posted much more in depth reviews than this and you should read them if you want to know more, just wanted to give my two cents.
Keep up the hustle!

The world atmosphere is awesome, does remind me of real life ghettos our there. I am one of those people who actually like walking around and exploring the environment more than straight up following a storyline, though I did like that, too. I also like mixing recipes and have learned more about chemistry from this game than from school. So the general gameplay for me is a lot of fun, there's quite a bit to do on your own, see what works and what doesn't. I do agree than in the real world there would be weapons involved but, at the end of the day, this is a game about drugs rather than violence. However, I think getting mugged when running around with loads of cash should be part of the game. As a downside, there are still bugs and I had to redownload the game right after I met La Ballena because it just would not show the first dead drop on my map. That was annoying, losing all that progress, but the game does have, to me, a lot of replayability. Also, the Psychedelic Gang quest, the beacons were a bit wonky. I found the first one right away, then nothing for like 3 days of looking hard all around, then the last two came in quick succession AND after I did the police station bit, I found another letter! So keep that in mind. I do hope the second time around I won't have to stop and redownload because I genuinely like getting immersed in the world they built here and I want to progress through the whole map.

Very fun game that will keep you entertained for a good amount of time. Game is very accurate and on par with real life, except some aspects. For example, the pricing to get me started, is up to standards with IRL pricing as of 2022, some things could go up in price though. The crystal meth is too cheap. I really like the accuracy this game has with the drug cutting/mixing system, and all the cuts and mixes that you can make. It ia very realistic, but one thing that is off is how easily clients come in game. It should be more realistic with how hard it is to find/get clients, and how quickly/how they get attached to your product. Police is perfectly balanced. All in all a 10/10 for a simulator game, and I look forward to Drug Dealer Sim 2.

edit:10/26/2022

I've given this game a few chances since it first released, and after (two?) years of updates I feel like it is still the same under-polished, over-promised little simulator game I was disappointed with before. I'm also seeing DDS2 on the steam market, which admittedly puts a bad taste in my mouth. I'm not seeing how releasing a sequel to an unfinished game makes any real sense. I get not lingering on past projects so your studio can move on, but the model of getting someone excited about possible game features that are then just tossed or pushed back to a sequel is super lame. I'd love to play more Drug Dealer Simulator, but this is not the game i was advertised years ago.

The game is fun don't get me wrong, but the more successful you get, the more you work pretty much and there's not that much other than the extra cash you have to show for it. I've heard that there's an end-game on it and that will be nice as now you just farm away without any other means than just stacking up those papers. 

I've had fun with the game, but chilling with 100k in my safe and have nothing to spend it on. I'll come back to it when the endgame update drops, other than that I hope DDS2 will have way more content on the spending side of things. 

El hefe out.

Best thing about this game you can get a trial version called "drug dealer simulator free sample" I miss the free trial version of games and it is huge that they provide one in this day and age. It's a old build but still shows a good bit of the game.

Otherwise I love this game to bits, but their are a few glaring flaws the devs need to work on. 

First and foremost are the somewhat occasional bugs and a lack of program optiomization. Just today i had two bugs come up, one where i couldn't see the orders on the side bar while packing and another where i couldn't end a police chase because the cops bugged out. I solved both with a few simple things, first on for the sidebar i reloaded the game, with the police bug i just got the attention of some other officers and hid from them to end the chase. 

This game is really rather unoptiomized. When i play i shut down most every other program that i can running on my client. I'm running a bit of a older gaming computer but even doing this it can be a strain on the cpu. I have been able to stream this game but i had lag isues until i dusted out my computer. Fair enough. 

The game is imo kinda easy, want to expand quick? Don't get caught expand over the boarder quickly and make a deal with Gustavo to sell him coke. It can be straight from your cartel source and you'll be loaded in no time. It seems ultra hard mode dosen't do much besides reduce the patience of clients whos orders you say you'd fill and increase the number of orders you get which is paradoxical to hardmode because  you can sit months on a order without saying your filling it but the customer dosen't care. Imagine your weed dealer legit responded to your message 3 weeks after you sent it saying he's got you. Man i bought from someone else weeks ago...

You can litterly run from the cops into your main production house close the door in their face and they will give up chasing you and won't search the premesis. 

The game needs to scale jail cost, make reputation drop slower maybe do some other things to put up the skill level for me to be satisfied.  I'm a hardcore gamer that likes it tough but even hard mode is easy street to me.

Personly i play with a half maxed speed, stamina and no stealth along with putting my screen brightness down to zero (not in the game mind you it dosen't have a setting for that, rather my own monitor), The game is unusualy bright even at night. I preventing my self from running into a safe house for immediate protection and ruff it by hiding somewhere on the open map.

At max speed and stamina with a bit of crystal meth you can run like sonic the hedge hog for miles. If you max out your stealth the cops become near sighted. It only really gets hard to deal when the K9's come into play but the exposure factor raises too slowly even on the hardest difficulty and goes down too quickly to make that last long.

I'd also like a option to censor the nudity of the graffiti for streaming purposes. (reserve our rights and lefts ext, just nudity on twitch ext. isn't a great idea.)


Overall i like this game a ton, i have over 300 hours. Just some of the problems stop me from loving this game.


Tldr: If your looking to dink around and make a drug empire in an easy sandbox this is your game. If your looking for a challenge like me your gunna have to play altered modes and nuzlock yourself hard.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I can't save my progress in this game. I keep my laptop working so I can keep my progress going. My laptop gets very hot, because the game is quite heavy, and the laptop is always on. I hibernate my laptop at night to give it a break. Then next day I have a little bit of time to continue with playing, but I still can't save. The game says something like "can't save yet, progress more". I don't know how much "more" to wait, to progress. I can't play much, don't have much free time, so it's very frustrating. I also don't want to overheat/overuse my laptop. It's a very bad experience. Do I need to play for 10 hours to start saving? I don't get it. It's the first game like this. I did enjoy the game (not perfect, but I kept playing), but the creators failed here big time. I just closed the game again, and lost all of my progress. It's the second time already. I prefer to keep my laptop in a good condition. You guys, creators, wasted lots of my very limited free time (and money that I paid for the game).

Since the Devs won't bother to make the fix themselves, I found a solution online to those with 11th and 12th gen Intel to get the game to actually RUN. 

Search 'advanced system settings'
Click 'environment variables'
Click 'new'

Variable Name: OPENSSL_ia32cap
Variable Value: ~0x200000200000000

Click 'Ok'
Restart Steam
Game should actually be playable now.

It's a good game, it's a bit tedious after awhile and some things like growing weed and DEA raids are either unclear or really glitchy, like you might get raided by the DEA and then they clear out your property and leave the plants floating where the pots were, or you harvest a fully grown weed plant and then it just stays there and says (harvested). Does it grow back? Should I take it down and replant? If it doesn't grow back why didn't it just go away when I harvested? You also can't make drugs in the game, which I feel is a huge missed opportunity. Yes you can do your own special blends and there are certain kinds that the game actually considers to be proper blends and semi-new brands of drugs but you're still going to be ordering kilos of amp and picking them up from a stack of tires when you basically own the city. Ultimately though, it's worth the asking price or you could easily wait for a sale, you'll get a good few hours from it and probably put it down.

Fatal error and save issue (Played on 9/2/2022)

First time I played: Game crashed with a fatal error window pop up. Before leaving the room to meet the contact, I noticed a panel next to the door with a display text to save the game. I clicked, and it says "Can't save game now". But I was not in the middle of anything. Game crashed later, losing all the progress.

Second time: The panel still says "Can't save game now" when I left the room for the first time. Then, I found the drugs at the vent opening, returned home and the panel says "Can't save game now". I went out to trade, returned and the panel said "Can't save game now". The night falls and Police Hour starts, the panel says "Can't save game now". I did not find the save button in the menu, and no autosave was triggered.

I exit the game eventually. Not surprisingly, the progress has not been saved. Frustrating, I do not intend to start a New Game again. 

I intended to ask for a refund, but my purchase was over 2 weeks so I couldn't do it.

*OPINION*  Mind numbing fun. This is a game that is strictly enjoyable for the game play mechanics alone(buying, selling, growing, cutting, running, hiding). the story is minimal, god awful and with terrible voice acting (for the most part, with what little voice acting there actually is in the game) now if they would just release some modding resources and allow the community to add things to it such as new drugs/furniture/gangs/buildings etc.... through the steam workshop it could be even better. or maybe at least add 2 player co-op so it doesn't feel AS repetitive.   As of now, if you feel the game getting stale after playing it for so long all you can do is start over and put self limiting rules on yourself such as selling specific drugs only, or No client OD's.

     That Being said, the game is well worth the price  its available for i would definitely give this at least a 7/10, a little more polish or things i mentioned above and this could easily be a 10/10 for its price range.

Drug Dealer Sim is one of those "I love it! I LOVE it! THIS IS SO GOOD!" type experiences, then WHAM. Hit in the face with a 'stuck' character. Sewers, houses, walls just about anywhere.. The worst was a few minutes ago. Since saving is only possible back at some of the homes rentable and not when you are out and about, it had been just over a solid hour of game-time and accomplishments when my character ran past some random scenery mesh and... stuck. Just.. standing there, running on the spot. I tried jumping, moving left, right, back, forward, sprinting, jumping again, crouching, hopping on one foot, sacrificing a lamb... no. Stuck. with no way to save all that work I had done. 

Since this could have been a positive review if not for the far-too-many 'stuck' scenarios that keep totally ruining the game's fun for me, I will amend this to reflect my experiences upon return.

Highly recommend playing for yourself.

The game is completely unfinished!
It is basically a walking simulator where you sell drugs, the gameplay is quite addicting and quite fun. 
But there is soo much stuff missing. [spoiler]There could be tons more drugs like benzodiazepines , and combinations like candy flipping, but there are already tons of "plotholes": eg. If you mix fentanyl with meth, people should notice. Someone slipped LSD into your weed, well PEOPLE SHOULD NOTICE. Going into the apartment when chased by the police? No problem, the police will just run past. Also the weights are complete f*cked. "LSD mix" is in grams. Just sell it as blotters of 100ug and done. And even worse the fentanyl, because if someone would give an opioid addict 0.01g of fentanyl, they would straight up die, while in this game, you can have that much in a gram of something else with minimal side effects. Also in the game, heroin is also called "china white" which is basically a derivative of fentanyl. [/spoiler]
All this is just from the top of my head, I could dig deeper but not in a comment.

TL:DR: Fun basic gameplay but completely unfinished and plotholes everywhere.
